title: M00n_Walk
author: M00n_Walk
content: Hi everyone!As a blockchain enthusiast I'm conducting research on how people use BTC blockchain explorers. Looking for ways to present the most useful insights from blockchain in a fast and simple manner. If you deal with crypto in any way and use blockchain explorer, please pass my survey by the link below. It will take about 3-5 minutes. You will help a lot to understand what is important to crypto specialists while searching information in blockchain.Link to the survey: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfulxnQX2cE-nD5EFt8-wBL3v6SqccdCYcERK0CqPXIahbM0A/viewform?usp=sf_linkAll the data collected anonymously, and will be used for research purposes only.Thank you very much!

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: I completed your survey. I hope it helps in the research you are conducting. I prefer mempool.space. I used to navigate to Blockchair and Blockstream in the past, but I find mempool.space much faster and more lightweight. And there are no ads and other nonsense. When it comes to use cases, most people use block explorers to check the status of a sent/received transaction. It's not the most recommended method to do it, especially over the clearnet. Blockchain explorers are great honeypots that hold data on who searches and looks for what, since most of the times people are looking at their own addresses. At least when you use one, you can pick a site that works over TOR. Or just check the status of your transactions in your native wallet app and don't lookup your own addresses over blockchain explorers at all. It's hard to stick to it though.
